data: The polar bear jumped out of the sea and snagged the Pomeranian from its perch.
No
Yes
Polar bears and Pomeranians are from vastly different habitats, making their interaction in this context anachronistic.
Johann Sebastian Bach wrote the book "Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy".
No
Yes
Johann Sebastian Bach was a composer, not an author of scientific works; "Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy" was written by Isaac Newton.
Dr. Elizabeth Garrett Anderson lifted her hand from her dark colored moto jacket and traced the pharaoh's cartouche on the newly transported obelisk in the City of Westminster.
Yes
Yes
Dr. Elizabeth Garrett Anderson lived in the 19th century, while "moto jacket" is a modern term, making the sentence anachronistic.
Eric the Red is credited with establishing the first permanent settlements in Greenland.
No
No
Eric the Red lived in the late 10th century and is historically recognized for founding the first Norse settlements in Greenland.
Charlamagne and the unrest under his rule is credited with the creation of Encarta, internet for the masses.
Yes
Yes
Charlamagne lived in the 8th-9th century, while Encarta, an internet-based encyclopedia, was created in the late 20th century.
Socrates was executed via lethal injection.
Yes
Yes
Socrates was executed in 399 BC by drinking poison hemlock, not by lethal injection, which is a modern execution method.
Prime Minister David Lloyd George said to his cabinet ministers: "I'm beginning to understand that World War I might be a more prolonged effort than we originally thought."
Yes
Yes
David Lloyd George could not have referred to the conflict as "World War I" during the war itself; the term is anachronistic.
The brand new Mars rover used its solar panel to keep its batteries charged.
No
No
The sentence is consistent with current technology and practices for Mars rovers, which often use solar panels for power.
Albert Einstein wrote to Bertram Vivian Bowden about his showcased biomedical engineering notes published in Faster than Thought: A Symposium on Digital Computing Machines.
No
Yes
Einstein died in 1955, and "Faster than Thought," a book on computing, was published in 1953, making the biomedical context anachronistic.
Squanto's role as a diplomat may have been essential in the provisions for the first Thanksgiving.
No
No
No, the sentence accurately places Squanto in a historical context relevant to his time period and the first Thanksgiving.
The US senator used his vote to help pass the Wade-Davis bill.
No
Yes
The Wade-Davis Bill was in 1864, and direct election of senators began in 1913, making the scenario anachronistic.
Luciano Pavarotti wrote the opera "The Marriage of Figaro".
Yes
Yes
Luciano Pavarotti was a famous tenor, not a composer; "The Marriage of Figaro" was written by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.
Homo neanderthalensis consumed corn as a main staple of their diet.
Yes
Yes
Corn was domesticated in the Americas long after Homo neanderthalensis had become extinct, making its inclusion anachronistic.
Homo Erectus, having survived as a species for millions of years, was known to wield scimitars against Smilodon.
Yes
Yes
Homo Erectus did not coexist with scimitars, a type of sword that came much later, making the statement anachronistic.
Plato thought Hume was an absolute idiot.
Yes
Yes
Plato lived in Ancient Greece (c. 428-348 BC), while David Hume was an 18th-century Scottish philosopher, making the statement anachronistic.
When scientists found the female Australopithecus afarensis, AL 288-1, they named her Lucy after the Beatles song.
No
Yes
Yes, because the Beatles song "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" inspired the name after the discovery, linking two different eras.
George Washington Carver told Mahatama Gandhi to eat more soy to improve his nutrition.
No
Yes
George Washington Carver and Mahatma Gandhi lived during overlapping times, but there's no record of them discussing nutrition or soy.
Jason, while exploring an ancient pyramid, opened a sealed box inside and found a floppy disk.
No
Yes
Yes, because floppy disks were not invented until the 20th century, making their presence in an ancient pyramid anachronistic.
The builders of the pyramids at Giza listened to music during their break.
No
Yes
The builders of the pyramids at Giza lived thousands of years ago, making the concept of recorded music anachronistic.
The Mongolian horse rider used his bow to hunt the deer.
No
No
The sentence is historically accurate as Mongolian horse riders have used bows for hunting for centuries.
Pepin the Short's wife, Bertrada, played passionate piano pieces the night before marching into battle.
Yes
Yes
Pepin the Short lived in the 8th century, but the piano wasn't invented until the early 18th century.
The first ever eggs Benedict was served to a cricket player.
No
Yes
Eggs Benedict is a dish from the 19th century, while cricket has been played since the 16th century, making the statement anachronistic.
Early hip hop was inspired by Cold War politics.
No
Yes
Early hip hop emerged in the 1970s, while Cold War politics spanned from after World War II to the early 1990s.
Beats from the MPC3000 helped inspire many original blues artists.
Yes
Yes
The MPC3000 is a sampler/sequencer from the 90s, while original blues artists emerged much earlier, making the statement anachronistic.
Homo neanderthalensis consumed meat as a main staple of their diet.
No
No
Homo neanderthalensis indeed had a diet that included meat, making the statement historically accurate and not anachronistic.
Kurt Cobain starred in the 1980 television show "Twin Peaks".
Yes
Yes
Kurt Cobain, a musician, did not star in "Twin Peaks," a show that premiered in 1990, making the statement anachronistic.
King Richard the Lionheart led the English armies in the Third Crusade.
No
No
King Richard the Lionheart did indeed lead the English armies in the Third Crusade, making the statement historically accurate.
The Hagia Sophia has seen drastic transformations to its interior from its inception, including becoming a church, a mosque, a museum, and back to a mosque again.
No
No
The transformations of the Hagia Sophia from a church to a mosque, then a museum, and back to a mosque are historically accurate.
McKenzie Scott and Bill Gates announced their divorce after 27 years of marriage.
No
Yes
McKenzie Scott was married to Jeff Bezos, not Bill Gates. Bill Gates was married to Melinda Gates, making the statement anachronistic.
The first ever eggs Benedict was served to an ultimate frisbee player.
Yes
Yes
Eggs Benedict was created in the 19th century, while ultimate frisbee was not invented until the 20th century.
Thomas Edison, Leonardo da Vinci, and Galileo Galilei, met in Geneva to envision the future of 5G wireless technology.
Yes
Yes
The individuals mentioned lived in different centuries, making it impossible for them to meet and discuss 5G technology.
Thomas Jefferson enjoyed honeycrisp apples on summer afternoons.
Yes
Yes
Honeycrisp apples were developed in the 1960s, long after Thomas Jefferson's time, making the statement anachronistic.
Pharoah Thutmose III successfully expanded the borders of the Egyptian empire through persistent military campaigns and improved military technology, such as spear tips made of jade.
No
Yes
Jade was not used by the Egyptians for spear tips; they primarily used materials like bronze and flint for weaponry.
Catherine the Great waltzed with the Qianlong Emperor at Catherine Palace.
No
Yes
Catherine the Great and the Qianlong Emperor never met; their reigns in Russia and China, respectively, did not overlap geographically.
Bessie Smith's two favorite musicians were Ravi Shankar and Shakira.
Yes
Yes
Bessie Smith lived from 1894 to 1937, while Ravi Shankar and Shakira gained fame much later, making the statement anachronistic.
The merchant traded some salt for a copy of his favorite book in the bustling city of Timbuktu, where Musa's glorious Madugu outshined all other buildings.
No
Yes
The term "Madugu" is not historically associated with Mansa Musa or Timbuktu, making the reference anachronistic in this context.
President Syngman Rhee sent a letter commending Hugo Chavez's birthday.
No
Yes
Syngman Rhee's presidency (1948-1960) and Hugo Chavez's life (1954-2013) did not overlap, making a letter exchange anachronistic.
Vasco de Gama avoided shipwreck by the Cape of Good Hope thanks to his astrolabe.
No
Yes
Yes, because Vasco da Gama did use navigational tools like the astrolabe, but the sentence itself isn't anachronistic.
Hannibal of Carthage would eventually pour gold down the throat of the richest man in Rome, Crassus the real estate mogul.
Yes
Yes
Hannibal and Crassus lived in different eras; Hannibal could not have interacted with Crassus, making the statement anachronistic.
Sun Tzu dedicated an entire chapter to describing the failure of Babylon.
No
Yes
Sun Tzu lived centuries before the fall of Babylon, making it impossible for him to describe its failure contemporaneously.
Richard III used LEDs to light his throne room.
Yes
Yes
LEDs are modern technology and Richard III lived in the 15th century, making the use of LEDs anachronistic.
Ivan the Terrible hired composer Palestrina to murder his son.
No
Yes
Ivan the Terrible and Palestrina lived in the same era, but Palestrina was a composer, not a murderer.
Genghis Khan built the satellite which captured the first image of the Great Wall of China in space.
Yes
Yes
Genghis Khan lived in the 12th and 13th centuries, long before the technology for satellites and space photography existed.
Melinda and Bill Gates announced their divorce in 1805, after 270 years of marriage.
Yes
Yes
Yes, because Melinda and Bill Gates were not alive in 1805, and a 270-year marriage is impossible for humans.
President Woodrow Wilson rallied Americans to support the U.S. joining the League of Nations.
No
No
The statement is historically accurate; Wilson did advocate for the U.S. joining the League of Nations after World War I.
Charles Babbage was a proficient Haskell programmer.
Yes
Yes
Charles Babbage lived in the 19th century, while Haskell, a programming language, was developed in the late 20th century.
William Shakespeare collaborated with John Fletcher to write Two Noble Kinsmen.
No
No
Shakespeare and Fletcher did indeed collaborate on "The Two Noble Kinsmen," making the statement historically accurate, not anachronistic.
Hedy Lamarr wrote most of her programming scripts in Julia.
Yes
Yes
Hedy Lamarr, an actress and inventor from the mid-20th century, could not have used Julia, a programming language created in 2012.
Joan of Arc achieved martyrdom by defeating a champion of American Ninja Warrior in single combat.
Yes
Yes
Joan of Arc lived in the 15th century, while American Ninja Warrior is a 21st-century television show.
Thomas Jefferson enjoyed watermelons on summer afternoons.
No
No
Watermelons have been cultivated for thousands of years, making it plausible for Thomas Jefferson to enjoy them in his era.
During their meetings in Bali, George Washington and the delegate of the Ashikaga shogunate exchanged gifts.
Yes
Yes
George Washington lived in the 18th century, while the Ashikaga shogunate ended in the 16th century, making the scenario anachronistic.
The recognition of Christianity as the official religion of both Ethiopia and the Roman Empire within the same century is notable.
No
Yes
Christianity was recognized as the Roman Empire's official religion in the 4th century, but Ethiopia's official adoption date is debated.
Bruce Springsteen was a fan of Marie Antoinette.
No
Yes
Bruce Springsteen, born in 1949, could not have been a contemporary fan of Marie Antoinette, who died in 1793.
The Dodo was capable of hunting large herbivores like the Iguandodon.
Yes
Yes
The Dodo was a flightless bird that lived in Mauritius and was not a predator, while the Iguanodon was a dinosaur.
George Washington fought in the American Civil War.
Yes
Yes
George Washington died in 1799, while the American Civil War occurred from 1861 to 1865, making the statement anachronistic.
Napoleon caught up on his sleep in his favorite nap pod, the EnergyPod.
Yes
Yes
Napoleon lived from 1769-1821, while the EnergyPod, a modern invention for napping, was not available during his lifetime.
Alexander Graham Bell killed Alexander Hamilton in a duel.
Yes
Yes
Alexander Graham Bell and Alexander Hamilton lived in different centuries, making it impossible for Bell to have killed Hamilton.
Caesar Octavian Augustus was the first emperor of the Holy Roman Empire.
Yes
Yes
Caesar Octavian Augustus was the first Roman Emperor of the Roman Empire, not the Holy Roman Empire, which came later.
The sun's creation during the Stelliferous Era is the cause of its size, color, and brightness.
No
No
The statement aligns with current astronomical understanding, linking the sun's characteristics to its formation period without anachronistic elements.
Abraham Lincoln and Manny Pacquiao kept a regular correspondence.
Yes
Yes
Abraham Lincoln lived in the 19th century, while Manny Pacquiao is a contemporary figure, making their correspondence anachronistic.
